com.ericdaugherty.lib.error
Class BusinessException

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--java.lang.Throwable
        |
        +--java.lang.Exception
              |
              +--com.ericdaugherty.lib.error.CascadingException
                    |
                    +--com.ericdaugherty.lib.error.BusinessException
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable
Direct Known Subclasses:
AlreadyExistsException, NotFoundException
public class BusinessException
extends CascadingException
implements java.io.Serializable

Indicates an application level error, or recoverable error has occured. This exception (and its subclasses) should be thrown when the application was unable to perform a specific action due to an acceptable reason. Some 'acceptable' reasons are:

  • User input was null or invalid
  • Requested object/information does not exist

For example, the NotFoundException extends this exception to indicate that the query did not return any results. If a user requested information about a specific 'location' and that location could not be found in the database (data source).

This exception should NOT be used to indicate failures that do not relate to user input or expected failure cases. For example, if the system is unable to log in to the database or access a required resource, you should use the SystemException class, or one of its subclasses.

Author:
Eric Daugherty (http://www.ericdaugherty.com/java/daughertylib)
See Also:

Constructor Detail

BusinessException

public BusinessException()
Creates a new exception without any additional information.

BusinessException

public BusinessException(java.lang.Throwable nextedException)
Creates a new exception and nests the exception (java.lang.Throwable) passed in as a parameter.
Parameters:
nextedException - captured as the 'original' exception and used to display error message and stacktrace information.

BusinessException

public BusinessException(java.lang.String msg)
Creates a new exception using the provided message. No original Exception is captured.
Parameters:
msg - A message describing the error that occured.

BusinessException

public BusinessException(java.lang.String msg,
                         java.lang.Object[] messageObjects)
Creates a new exception using the provided message. No original Exception is captured.

Also accepts an Object array for use in formatting the message using the MessageFormat class.

Parameters:
msg - A message describing the error that occured.
messageObjects - objects used to format the msg String.

BusinessException

Parameters:
msg - A message describing the error that occured.
nextedException - captured as the 'original' exception and used to display error message and stacktrace information.
